newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Korean Air to supply parts to Boeing.
newsitem.headline: Korean Air to supply parts to Boeing.

text.p: Korean Air Co Ltd said on Monday it had agreed to supply $600 million worth of aircraft parts to Boeing Co until 2006.
A formal contract on the supply of wing tips and flap track fairings would be signed on Wednesday in Seoul, according to a statement by South Korea's national flagcarrier.
It said the parts would be for Boeing's 500-seat passenger aircraft B747-500X/600X currently in development. Boeing expects to sell approximately 1,000 planes until 2006, it added.
Korean Air, the flagship of Hanjin Group HANJ.CN, plans to start designing the parts in January 1997 for production in June 1998, it said.
First supplies to Boeing are scheduled for June 1999.
